Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Andrew Massucco and for defendant, Irma R. Valldejuli. Defendant is present in Court and is (U/C). Arraignment and Detention Hearing as to Alex Rivera-Burgos (19) Count 1,1s,2,2s,3,3s,4,4s held on 12/5/2008. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and enters a PONG as to all counts. The case is referred to Judge Delgado for trial setting. As to detention, defense counsel states that she has reviewed the pretrial report and has interviewed defendant in jail. Defendant has no prior criminal record. Common law wife present in Court. She further states that they live with grandfather in Vega Baja. They have no property, but defendant's grandfather is willing to post a monetary bail of $5,000.00 with all conditions that the court may impose and further request home confinement, so that defendant can work. Defense counsel further states that defendant's daughter is very much affected. Counsel for the Government is heard and requests that defendant be detain. The Court after hearing both counsel grants bail as follows: Bail set in the amount of $25,000.00 cash or  secured. Electronic monitoring with Home Detention. Defendant shall participate in a substance abuse treatment program, inpatient or outpatient as determine by the Pretrial Office. Defendant cannot reside in La Trocha or near La Trocha in Vega Baja. The place where defendant will leave, shall be qualified by the Pretrial Office. All standard conditions of release are applicable as well. (Court Reporter FTR.)(Court Interpreter Felix Toledo.)Hearing set for 11:30.Hearing held at 11:33.Hearing ended at 11:47. (mn) Modified on 12/9/2008 to edit atty's name for deft (ov). (Entered: 12/08/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Arraignment and Detention Hearing as to Juan G. Guzman-Torres (30) held on 12/5/2008. Defendant waived the reading of the indictment. Plea of not guilty is entered as to Counts 1s-4s. Case is referred to Judge Aida Delgado-Colon for trial setting. The government requested detention without bail, but stated that if the Court were to grant bail, it should be set at $50,000 cash or secured, with no contact with minor common law wife. Defense counsel argued in favor of setting conditions of release. The Court set bail at $50,000 ($25,000 secured and $25,000 unsecured), with mental health and drug treatment, 3rd party custodian, plus standard conditions of release. Defendant may not reside at La Trocha Ward nor may he contact any codefendants or witnesses unless in the presence of counsel, including relatives of his common law wife. Pretrial Services shall file an informative motion as to the outcome of potential 3rd party custodian interviews. The Court takes the matter of the minor common law wife under advisement. (AUSAs G. Andrew Massucco. Atty Jose Aguayo. PO Wallace Bustelo. CI Hilda Gutierrez. CR FTR.) (Hearing set for 9:00, held at 12:07, ended at 12:22.) (jm) (Entered: 12/11/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Olga Castellon and for defendant, Jose Olmo- Rodriguez. Defendant is present in Court and is (U/C).Arraignment and Bail Hearing as to Giovanni Santiago-Oquendo (39) Count 1,1s,2,2s,3,3s,4,4s held on 12/15/2008. Defendant waived the reading of the Indictment and enters a PONG as to all counts. The case is referred to Judge Delgado for trial setting. As to bail, defense counsel is heard and states that defendant is presently under probation in the state court for charges in this conspiracy which is now being charge in the federal court. Defendant has been employed and has been complying with all conditions and requests to be release on his own recognition. Counsel for the Government is heard and states that defendant was found guilty to which defense counsel states that he pled guilty. She further states that defendant was engage in selling narcotics in this case at La Trocha in Vega Baja. She further states that she has no information as to where defendant will reside if the Court grants bail. She further requests that bond be for at least $25,000.00 and electronic monitoring. Further arguments by counsel are heard. The Court after making inquiries to both counsel states that bail is set in the amount of $20,000.00 cash or secured. Shall undergo substance abuse treatment, in patient or outpatient as determine by PT Office. Electronic monitoring and Home Detention. Shall not reside near La Trocha Ward in Vega Baja. All standard conditions of release shall also apply. Abide by the Probation or Supervision in state level and with the conditions imposed in the federal level. Defense counsel requests reconsideration to which the Court states to counsel to make all efforts with family and friends to post bail, if not a motion for reconsideration may be filed. (Court Reporter FTR.)(Court Interpreter eDNA bRAYFIELD.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 01:51.Hearing ended at 02:04. (mn) (Entered: 12/16/2008)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:, Show Cause Hearing as to defense counsel held on 3/19/2009. Counsel apologizes for his failure to once again appear before this Court. The Court strongly admonishes counsel, that next time a fine will be imposed. DeNovo Hearing as to Angel Gonzalez-Lugardo held on 3/19/2009. Defense counsel informs he won't challenge the allegations. The defendant did indeed test positive to the use of controlled substances while being under custody at MDC-Guaynabo. However, once again clarifies that the defendant did voluntary  surrender. Government proceeds by proffer and seeks detention. The Court modifies the bail imposed as follows: The defendant will be placed on a electronic monitoring device. The defendant will remain under 24 hour house arrest until he finds and secures an employment. Once employed, the defendant will have a curfew from 6:00 a.m. thru 6:00 p.m. All other conditions of release and amount imposed by the Magistrate Judge, remain as set. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)(Court Interpreter Tom Kavelin.) Hearing set for 5:00 p.m. Hearing held at 6:14 p.m. Hearing ended at 6:30 p.m. (sr) Prsent: AUSA Olga Castellon and defense counsel Francisco Dolz. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Nancy Mendez also present. (Entered: 03/20/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon:Show Cause Hearing as to Yomar Hernandez-Maldonado held on 8/4/2009. Counsel for defendant informs that his client won't contest the violations, as so informed by the USPO. Court notes that at state level, probable cause was found on 6/16/09 and his trial date is set for tomorrow. Therefore, the Court revokes the bail imposed by the Magistrate Judge on 12/2/08. Being that the defendant has a trial date tomorrow, the Court orders the government to make necessary arrangements to insure that the defendant won't miss his trial date. US Marshals are to return him to the custody of the state officials. Government to move the Court to have defendant returned to Federal Custody, once state level proceedings have concluded. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)(Court Interpreter Hilda Gutierrez.) Hearing set for 4:00 p.m. Hearing held at 4:35 p.m. Hearing ended at 4:50 p.m. (sr) Present: AUSA Olga Castellon and defense counsel Ernesto Hernandez- Milan. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Luis Santana also present. (Entered: 08/05/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Motion Hearing as to Aramis Nunez-Aybar held on 9/24/2009 re 763 EX-PARTE INFORMATIVE motion, MOTION Requesting Order. Court explains to the defendant the purpose of today's hearing. Upon inquiry of the Court, defendant denies having spoken about his case with attorney Armenteros without having his legal counsel present. Attorney Cortes reiterates that the information noted on the motion had been provided by her client. Attorney Armenteros denies any wrongdoing. Count strongly admonishes attorney Armenteros that should he need to contact any defendant, other than the one he represents, he must first contact that defendant's legal counsel and get authorization to interview such defendant. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)(Court Interpreter Annie Flores.) Hearing set for 2:00 p.m. Hearing held at 2:20 p.m. Hearing ended at 2:50 p.m. (sr) Present: SAUSA Mario Torres and defense counsel Marie Cortes. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. Attorney Armenteros also present. Modified on 9/25/2009 to substitute dkt #809 for #763 (ni). (Entered: 09/25/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Mag. Judge Justo Arenas: Change of Plea Hearing as to Luis Moran-Morales held on 12/22/2009. AUSA Michael Bagge and defense counsel Rosa Bonini were present. Defendant was present in court and under custody. Consent was approved, filed and made part of the record. The defendant was found competent to plea. The Magistrate Judge will recommend to the Court that the Plea of Guilty be accepted as to Count One (1) of the Indictment. At the time of sentencing, the Government will request the dismissal of the remaining counts. The defendant is to remain under custody. A report and recommendation will be issued. The Court ordered the preparation of a presentence report. Sentence will be set at a later date. (Court Reporter FTR/bg, CD: Brenda Gonzalez.) (Court Interpreter Annie Flores.) Hearing set for 10:00. Rescheduled for 2:00. Hearing held at 02:31. Hearing ended at 02:49. (br) (Entered: 12/22/2009)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Motion Hearing as to Jesse Colon-Colon held on 3/11/2010 re 1865 Third MOTION for Medical Treatment (urgent surgery) filed by Jesse Colon-Colon. Statements heard on behalf of the defense in support of its request. Government informs that the defendant did receive initial treatment and is scheduled to receive twelve therapy sessions (March 12, 15, 17, 19, 22, 24, 26, 29, 31 and on April 1, 5, 7). Dr. Ada Rivera, from the medical personnel at MDC-Guaynabo, provides a detailed account as to all the medical calls, appointments and procedures the defendant has had since August 9, 2009 (date of the fall in which defendant hurt his hand). Expects that by the third or fourth therapy session she can advise the Court if whether the defendant will need to undergo reconstructive surgery. Based on the information provided, the Court ordersthat before 3/26/2010, Dr. Ada Rivera submit a written report addressing the defendant's progress and if surgery is needed. If defendant is in need of surgery, the Sentencing date of 4/21/2010 will be advanced, so that defendant can receive proper treatment at the designated facility. USPO to inform how soon the PSR will be made available. It's noted that if there's a need to advance the Sentencing date, the defense has no objection.(Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)(Court Interpreter Annie Flores.) Hearing set for 2:00 p.m. Hearing held at 2:20 p.m. Hearing ended at 2:50 p.m. (sr) Present: SAUSA Rosaida Melendez and defense counsel Juan Nieves-Cassas. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. Attorney Jorge L. Matos and Dr. Ada Rivera, from MDC-Guaynabo) also present. (Entered: 03/12/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Sentencing Hearing as to Yolanda Torres-Hernandez not held on 6/24/2010. Court notes that despite having been electronically notified of today's setting, defense counsel Maria Sandoval has failed to appear in court and her client, who is on bond, isn't present either. Therefore, within the next five (5)days, attorney Sandoval is Ordered to Show Cause as to why sanctions should not be imposed for her failure to appear in court. Government's counsel informs that the case agent and two witnesses are available and that she will present their testimonies to address the drug quantity for which the defendant is to be held responsible and to address the defendant's role within the conspiracy. The Court notes that the government has failed to timely file an objection to the PSR, which was disclosed on 3/12/2010, and to make the case agent available to the USPO. Therefore, sentencing memos are to be filed and all pertinent information is to be available. Show Cause Response due by 7/1/2010. Sentencing Memorandum Filing due by 7/6/2010. Sentencing Hearing reset for 7/12/2010 at 11:00 AM in Courtroom 1 before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)(Court Interpreter Annie Flores.) Hearing set for 1:00 p.m. Hearing held at 1:55 p.m. Hearing ended at 2:00 p.m. (sr) Present: AUSA Olga Castellon. USPO Merangelie Serrano also present. (Entered: 06/24/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Sentencing held on 8/2/2010 for Jose Figueroa-Camacho (55). Statements in support of mitigation of punishment are heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. Count(s) 1s, Term of imprisonment: Statutory minimum of sixty (60) months is imposed, however, 1042 days are credited for time served at local level for relevant conduct for the offense charged. Therefore, defendant is to serve twenty-six (26) months of imprisonment, to be served concurrently with undischarged term of state sentence. Defendant to be credited for time served under BOP custody. SRT of eight (8) years. No fine. SMA of $100.00.; Count(s) 2s, 3s, 4s, Dismissed. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) (Court Interpreter Janis Palma.) Hearing set for 3:00 p.m. Hearing held at 2:55 p.m. Hearing ended at 3:40 p.m. (sr) Present: AUSA Olga Castellon and defense counsel Carlos Beck. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. USPO Victor Carlo also present. (Entered: 08/03/2010)

Muinute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Court addresses the issue that the defendant had been undergoing mental evaluation. It's placed on the record, that the defendant was evaluated by four physicians, and the general conclusion is that the defendant is competent to proceed. Defense counsel agrees and the plea agreement was reviewed and discussed with him. Arraignment and Plea Hearing as to Antonio Joel Roman-De-Jesus held on 10/29/2010. The defendant is found competent to enter a plea. The defendant is advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and  the applicable statutory guidelines. Plea of guilty entered as to Count One (1) of the Superseding Indictment by Antonio Joel Roman-De-Jesus (10). PSR to be prepared. Sentencing date to be set by the Court. **USPO Notified** (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.)(Court Interpreter Hilda Gutierrez.) Hearing set for 10:00 a.m. Hearing held at 10:00 a.m. Hearing ended at 10:55 a.m. (sr) Present: AUSAs Tim Henwood and Olga Castellon. Defense counsel Miriam Ramos. Defendant assisted by Court Interpreter. (Entered: 11/01/2010)
